title: How to avoid writing in the first and second person - Quora

response.answer_text: To avoid writing in first person, avoid writing words such as I, we, me, our, ours, mine, etc. Basically anything that would be from the writer’s/narrator’s perspective. “I ate some pizza with Mom, Dad, and my two younger siblings. Second person is a word such as you, your, or yours. Implying that the story is told from the reader’s perspective, where the reader is asked to imagine being the central character. “You feel something shaking beneath your feet as you walk, as if an earthquake is about to happen at any moment.

First person is: I did this. I did that. I felt a gust of cool air. Second person: You did this. You did that. You feel a gust of cool air. Third person: She did this. She did that. Roksana felt a gust of cool air. It’s all in the pronouns… don’t use ‘I’ or ‘you’. You write a LOT of questions on Quora… how do you get any work done? :-)
